Paul - 

No info for you but I did want to mention that I'm doing an exhibit on Naokatsu (and other shinshinto smiths loaned by others) at the upcoming Minneapolis show and shinsa on the 15th. I'm curious if you have a sword by this fellow Kajihei and if so, are you attending this show? It promises to be a very interesting "cultural" weekend taking in lots of other interests than swords. Should be good!

Ron
STL
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: paul bowman 
  To: study group 
  Sent: Sunday, June 03, 2007 10:30 AM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Kajihei


  Dear All, 
  Im looking for information on Kajihei, the son/student of Jiritaro Naokatsu. 
  He seems to have a mixed reputation in that he was a highly skilled smith but specilaised in making counterfeit blades of top Koto and Shinto smiths. 
  Trying to work out whether he was a victim of the times trying to survive the downturn in demand for swords or just a dishonest but highly skilled crook. 
  All information/ leads gratefully received. 
  thanks 
  PaulB
